metadata.title: USN-6129-2 -- Avahi vulnerability
metadata.description: USN-6129-1 fixed a vulnerability in Avahi. This update provides the corresponding update for Ubuntu 14.04 LTS, Ubuntu 16.04 LTS and Ubuntu 18.04 LTS.  Original advisory details:   It was discovered that Avahi incorrectly handled certain DBus messages. A  local attacker could possibly use this issue to cause Avahi to crash,  resulting in a denial of service.  Update Instructions:  Run `sudo pro fix USN-6129-2` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions:  libavahi-compat-libdnssd-dev - 0.7-3.1ubuntu1.3+esm1 libavahi-ui-gtk3-0 - 0.7-3.1ubuntu1.3+esm1 libavahi-core7 - 0.7-3.1ubuntu1.3+esm1 libavahi-client3 - 0.7-3.1ubuntu1.3+esm1 libavahi-core-dev - 0.7-3.1ubuntu1.3+esm1 libavahi-client-dev - 0.7-3.1ubuntu1.3+esm1 avahi-ui-utils - 0.7-3.1ubuntu1.3+esm1 libavahi-gobject-dev - 0.7-3.1ubuntu1.3+esm1 avahi-dnsconfd - 0.7-3.1ubuntu1.3+esm1 libavahi-compat-libdnssd1 - 0.7-3.1ubuntu1.3+esm1 libavahi-common3 - 0.7-3.1ubuntu1.3+esm1 avahi-daemon - 0.7-3.1ubuntu1.3+esm1 avahi-discover - 0.7-3.1ubuntu1.3+esm1 libavahi-common-dev - 0.7-3.1ubuntu1.3+esm1 libavahi-common-data - 0.7-3.1ubuntu1.3+esm1 avahi-utils - 0.7-3.1ubuntu1.3+esm1 libavahi-ui-gtk3-dev - 0.7-3.1ubuntu1.3+esm1 libavahi-glib-dev - 0.7-3.1ubuntu1.3+esm1 libavahi-gobject0 - 0.7-3.1ubuntu1.3+esm1 gir1.2-avahi-0.6 - 0.7-3.1ubuntu1.3+esm1 avahi-autoipd - 0.7-3.1ubuntu1.3+esm1 python-avahi - 0.7-3.1ubuntu1.3+esm1 libavahi-glib1 - 0.7-3.1ubuntu1.3+esm1 Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro
